text: - My name is Deepak Sury.

I'm the General Manager for
Resilience Infrastructure
and Solutions at AWS.

My career at AWS, it's
been almost 11 years now.
I started off as a Product Manager in EC2.

My heart was really in
the infrastructure space.

My team focuses on AWS
infrastructure services,
and our role really is to help make sure
that AWS operates resiliently
with high availability for our customers.
Every person on my team is a builder.

There are a set of engineers
who work on these services
that are extremely highly available.
They have a 100% availability target,
which is very unusual.
So the opportunity then, for an engineer,
is to think very deeply about
how to meet those resilience targets.

The work-life balance is
definitely super important
for me personally,
as a leader on the team,

to make sure that my team
is working sustainably.
I make sure that team members know
that they're completely flexible
in terms of how they operate.

Folks have different
responsibilities at home,
are pursuing other interests as well,
like outside of work.

So, I wanna make sure
that there's flexibility

in terms of engaging in those
responsibilities as well.

The scope for invention
and being an entrepreneur
taking ownership of a problem,
and having a large amount of empowerment

or being empowered to go solve
the problem for the customer,
it's, I think, very unusual.

It's something that's built
into the DNA of the company.

From an engineer coming
into the company new,

from say school, or to
our senior most leaders,
that attitude and DNA is quite built in,

which makes it pretty
exciting to be at Amazon.
(upbeat music)
